title: INFLUENCE OF DRUG-POLYMER INTERACTIONS ON RELEASE KINETICS OF PLGA AND PLA/PEG NPS

authors.name: Merve Gul
affiliations: Department of Drug Sciences, University of Pavia

authors.name: Ida Genta
affiliations: Department of Chemical Engineering, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya (UPC-EEBE)

authors.name: Maria M. Perez Madrigal

authors.name: Carlos Aleman

authors.name: Enrica Chiesa
affiliations: Barcelona Research Center for Multiscale Science and Engineering, EEBE, Universitat Politècnica de Catalunya

summary: The influence of drug-polymer interactions on the release kinetics of PLGA and PLA/PEG NPs was investigated.
methods: The study involved the synthesis of NPs using microfluidic technology, the encapsulation of CURC in the NPs, and the release of the CURC from the NPs.
results: {'1. Physical Properties of NPs': 'The NPs had uniform size distribution with a polydispersity index (PDI) of less than 0.2, as observed by transmission electron microscopy (TEM). The NPs were hydrophobic and had a high encapsulation efficiency (EE%) of 61.91 ± 1.86% for CURC-loaded PLGA NPs and 13.74 ± 0.97% for CURC-loaded PLA/PEG micelles.', '2. Release Kinetics of NPs': 'The CURC-loaded NPs showed a slower release rate compared to the CURC-loaded PLA/PEG micelles. The CURC-loaded NPs had a h
